episodeTitle: A State of Emergency is Issued! A Notorious Pirate Ship Has Infiltrated!
description: The Going Merry crashes inside the heavily fortified G-8 Marine Base after falling from Skypiea. The scattered Straw Hat crew must find each other and escape while Vice Admiral Jonathan strategically investigates the pirate infiltration.

events.title: Going Merry Falls from Sky into G-8 Base
events.description: The Going Merry crashes down from Skypiea, falling from the sky directly into the heavily fortified G-8 Marine Base on Navarone Island. Mekao, a Marine carpenter, witnesses the ship's descent and alerts the base.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of the G-8 Arc, setting up the Straw Hats' most strategic escape challenge yet as they're trapped inside an entire Marine fortress.

quotes.text: In the old days, people used to treat ships with respect... What?! Look at that!
quotes.speaker: Mekao
quotes.context: Mekao spots the Going Merry falling from the sky

events.title: Marines Sound Emergency Alert
events.description: The Marines sound the alarm throughout G-8 Base as they detect the Going Merry crashing inside their fortress. They initially believe they're under attack from the sky and scramble to their battle stations.
events.significance: Establishes the main conflict of the arc - the Straw Hats must escape from inside a fully operational Marine base while outnumbered and separated.

quotes.text: We are under attack from the sky! All personnel to your stations!
quotes.speaker: Marine Officer
quotes.context: Marines responding to the Going Merry's unexpected arrival

events.title: Vice Admiral Jonathan's Introduction
events.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan, the strategic and laid-back commander of G-8 Base, is introduced as he begins investigating the mysterious arrival of the Going Merry. Unlike typical Marines, he immediately suspects logical explanations rather than supernatural causes.
events.significance: Jonathan becomes the primary antagonist of the G-8 Arc, notable for being one of the most intelligent and tactical opponents the Straw Hats have faced, using strategy over brute force.

quotes.text: I wonder why the Straw Hats are at our base. I'll just have to wait and see.
quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan contemplating the Straw Hat Pirates' arrival

events.title: Lieutenant Commander Drake Reports to Jonathan
events.description: Lieutenant Commander Drake, Jonathan's right-hand officer, reports the situation to the Vice Admiral. Drake is shown as a persistent and easily irritated officer who will lead the pursuit of the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Introduces Drake as Jonathan's primary field officer who will actively hunt the scattered crew members throughout the arc.

quotes.text: Sir, pirates have invaded the base. The Going Merry has been confirmed as the Straw Hat Pirates' vessel.
quotes.speaker: Drake
quotes.context: Drake reporting to Jonathan about the infiltration

events.title: Marines Believe Going Merry is a Ghost Ship
events.description: The Marines are initially convinced that the Going Merry is a ghost ship due to its seemingly impossible arrival from the sky. This creates confusion and fear among the lower-ranked Marines.
events.significance: Adds a humorous element to the arc and showcases the Marines' superstitious nature when faced with unexplainable phenomena.

quotes.text: It must be a ghost ship! How else could it fall from the sky?
quotes.speaker: Marine Soldier
quotes.context: Marines trying to explain the Going Merry's arrival

events.title: Jessica's Introduction
events.description: Jessica, the head chef at G-8 and Jonathan's wife, is introduced. She is shown managing the base's kitchen operations with authority and competence.
events.significance: Jessica becomes an important supporting character in the arc, representing the domestic side of the Marine base and Jonathan's personal life.

events.title: Marine Support Staff Introduced
events.description: Various support personnel at G-8 are introduced, including Mekao (the mechanic/carpenter), Shinpachi (a chef), and Billy (a cook). These characters establish the functioning ecosystem of the Marine base.
events.significance: Shows that G-8 is not just a military installation but a complete community with various roles and personalities.

events.title: Straw Hats Scattered Throughout Base
events.description: The crew members are shown scattered in different areas of the massive G-8 Base, each trying to avoid detection and find their crewmates. This establishes the primary challenge of the arc.
events.significance: Sets up the episodic structure of the arc where crew members must use their individual skills to survive and reunite.

events.title: Robin Uses Oreja Fleur
events.description: Nico Robin uses her Hana Hana no Mi ability to sprout an ear on a wall, allowing her to eavesdrop on Marine conversations. She employs the technique called 'Oreja Fleur' (Ear Flower) to gather intelligence.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's tactical use of her Devil Fruit powers for espionage, showcasing how her abilities are perfect for stealth operations.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin using her ability to sprout an ear for eavesdropping

events.title: Luffy's Comical Stealth Attempt
events.description: Luffy attempts to sneak through the base by literally copying the movements and poses of a Marine guard in an exaggerated manner. Sanji observes this and thinks about how Luffy never takes things seriously.
events.significance: Provides comic relief and showcases Luffy's unique and often ridiculous approach to problems, which paradoxically sometimes works.

events.title: Jonathan Begins Strategic Hunt
events.description: Rather than immediately launching an all-out assault, Jonathan decides to methodically investigate and set up strategic ambushes for the Straw Hats. He treats the situation like a chess game.
events.significance: Establishes Jonathan as a different type of antagonist who uses intelligence and patience rather than overwhelming force.

quotes.text: We'll use strategy, not force. Set up ambushes at key locations.
quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan planning his tactical approach to capturing the Straw Hats

quotes.text: I wonder why the Straw Hats are at our base. I'll just have to wait and see.
quotes.speaker: Jonathan
quotes.context: Jonathan's calm and strategic response to the infiltration

quotes.text: In the old days, people used to treat ships with respect... What?! Look at that!
quotes.speaker: Mekao
quotes.context: Mekao witnessing the Going Merry falling from the sky

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin using her ability to eavesdrop on Marines

themes.description: The episode establishes Jonathan as an antagonist who relies on tactical thinking and strategy rather than brute force, contrasting with typical Marine villains.
themes.symbolism: Jonathan's chess-playing hobby symbolizes his methodical and strategic approach to combat.

themes.description: The Straw Hats must adapt to being separated and trapped in enemy territory, showcasing their individual survival skills and resourcefulness.
themes.symbolism: The scattered crew represents how each member must stand on their own before reuniting as a team.

themes.description: The Marines initially believe the Going Merry is a ghost ship, showing how unexplainable phenomena can be rationalized. Jonathan's skepticism contrasts with his subordinates' superstition.
themes.symbolism: The ghost ship myth represents how fear can cloud judgment.

characterSpotlights.development: Jonathan is established as an intelligent, laid-back, and strategic Marine Vice Admiral who approaches problems like chess games rather than battles.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire G-8 Arc is anime-only filler and does not appear in the manga. The manga goes directly from Skypiea to the Davy Back Fight.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode of the G-8 Arc, which is widely considered the best filler arc in One Piece. In 2019, series director Konosuke Uda revealed this arc's plot was originally considered for a theatrical film.
This episode marks the debut of 'Dreamship' by Aiko Ikuta as the ending theme, which would be used through episode 206.
Drake shares his name, sideburns, and Japanese voice actor (Eiji Takemoto) with X Drake, a canonical Worst Generation member, though they are completely different characters.
Drake is the only character to be first introduced in a movie (Movie 4: Dead End Adventure) before making an appearance in the anime.
Jonathan is named after Jonathan Livingston Seagull, a novella about a seagull learning about life and flight.
The episode achieved a 12.2% TV rating in Japan and ranked 3rd in viewership for its time slot.
